page.title: 11MILK DELIVERIES
page.content: milk he delivers trebles.The round is on alternate days in winter.He doesn't like cartoned milk because if all the milk was in cartons there would be a montain of cartons you couldn't burn. Unigate delivers his milk and St Ivel his cream.Cream double or clotted is 60p a 1/4.In the last 10 years people have become more conscious of fats so they have changed to skimmed milk.To deliver the milk they have to get up at 4 a.m. in the summer and 5.30 a.m. in the winter.The biggest cost of all is labour although fuel costs are high.He owns 2 petrol engined vans and 1 diesel.The diesel is cheaper to run,easier to maintain and more reliable.There are no starting problems either although fuel is harder to get for the diesel.
